newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Britain's defence secretary to visit Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Britain's defence secretary to visit Hong Kong.

text.p: British Defence Secretary Michael Portillo is scheduled to arrive in Hong Kong on Wednesday for his first visit to the territory's garrison, the government said in statement on Tuesday.

Portillo will be briefed on arrangements for the transition to Chinese rule at midnight on June 30, particularly on the role of British forces in the handover ceremonies, and will meet Governor Chris Patten and other senior government officials.
During the one-day tour, Portillo will also inspect a ceremonial Quarter Guard drawn from the Black Watch regiment and tour the navy, army and air force units that form the garrison.
Portillo will travel to Brunei after visiting Hong Kong.
